review: I'm very impressed with the HD image, which may have as much to do with my FiOS signal as the Fire TV, but the combination means I get a crystal-clear image, whether it's Netflix, Prime, Watch ESPN, or History. It seems soooo stupid that in order to access Watch ESPN, you have to already have access to ESPN via a cable or FiOS operator, but that's not the Fire TV's fault. It's what keeps us from cutting the cord completely.I loved that when I plugged in the device, it greeted me by name and had my Watchlist queued up and ready. I can't find a way to turn the device off, but I haven't let that worry me too much. I haven't tried any games, but the TV-watching apps have all worked as well as I hoped.
